raw_videos.description:
When I was 20 I was broke and lost so I decided to move to LA to pursue my dream of becoming a dancer.  I struggled for a long time and learned a lot of hard lessons along the way.  Here are the 20 things that I wish I knew in my 20's for not just my career, but also relationships and happiness.  

I hope you take something away from this and can reach everything you want in life.  But more importantly, enjoy the journey no matter how long it takes.  Thank you for being part of my community and my story, I'm forever grateful.

I Was Just a Shy 10-Year-Old... Then One Night Everything Changed
raw_videos.description:
Kaycee Rice is an acclaimed dancer, choreographer, and actress who found success by the age of 10. Now at 19, and followed by millions across platforms, Kaycee continues to make her mark across the U.S. and internationally.

Throughout her professional dance career, Kaycee has been fortunate enough to perform on some of the world’s biggest stages, including the Super Bowl, the Academy Awards, and NBC’s World of Dance. She has been a featured dancer in music videos (Meghan Trainor, Olivia Rodrigo, & SuperFruit), and has performed alongside artists such as Janet Jackson, Justin Bieber, Missy Elliott, Katy Perry, Pharrell Williams, Kid Cudi, Flo Rida, & Charli XCX. Kaycee continues to develop her own choreography — creating personal concept videos, teaching classes across the globe, and creating for professional music artists (i.e. Red Velvet). 

Along with dance, Kaycee is an actress who played the lead in Disney’s short film “How To Catch A Ghost,” and starred in the Brat TV YouTube series “Sunnyside Up.”

Kaycee has a diverse portfolio of past partnerships — tech companies including AT&T and Dell, beauty brands YSL Beauty and Givenchy Beauty, and athletic lifestyle brands FILA and Nike. At the age of 14 she designed her own sneaker for Nike.

Driven by self-love, individuality, and positivity, Kaycee launched WEIRDO apparel in 2017 to build community and empower her followers. Kaycee’s goal is to continue to inspire, encourage, and uplift others across all facets of her life. 

--------

raw_videos.title: How To Become Confident In ANY Situation
raw_videos.description:
There's an @AlexHormozi quote that I really love, where he says, “confidence is having a stack of undeniable proof that you are who you say you are.” What that means is that you have to stack small wins. 

So, here's the game plan: Say you're hitting the gym. Even if it's the toughest workout ever, just showing up is a win. Take that dance class, even if you feel a bit rusty. 

Each small step you take builds momentum, and that momentum transforms into confidence.💪

#dancetutorials #danceonline #danceinspiration

raw_videos.description:
Let's retire the term 'starving artist'...

I started out in LA with nothing, truly a 'starving artist.' But that label limited my belief in what I could achieve. 

Today, I'm living a life that I never could've imagined in the beginning – there were three main things that helped me do that:

1️⃣ Say Yes: When you're first starting out, you don't have the luxury to pick and choose what things you do and don't do.

2️⃣ Provide Value: Don't just ask for collaborations. Show up with a plan on how you can contribute value. 

3️⃣ Know Your Worth: As you start to build that momentum, now you have the luxury of choosing a bit more, and it's really important to know your worth.

raw_videos.title: TATOOD GUY CRASHES OUR DANCE VIDEO 😱
BULLIED DANCER'S 1 YEAR TRANSFORMATION!
raw_videos.description:
After 1 year of hip hop dance training, Lizzy Howell returns to get redemption!
▶ Dance Tutorials with me & Lizzy: https://dncr.com/lizzy-sp/

I'm so proud of Lizzy and all the work she's put in behind the scenes.  I remember how hard it was for me to make the move out to LA from the east coast, feeling so alone, so far from my family and things that were familiar.  Following her story the past couple years making the move and chasing her dreams has been so inspiring and shows that you can do anything you put your mind to.  I'm really excited to keep growing with her on this journey and to announce that she'll be joining us for even more classes on DNCR.com in the coming weeks!  This truly is only the beginning :)

▶ Follow Matt: https://instagram.com/MattSteffanina
▶ Follow Lizzy: https://instagram.com/Lizzy.Dances

For more videos, subscribe and hit the bell to turn notifications on!  

Special thanks to Jordan Matter & Dhar Mann!  

#Dance #MattSteffanina #LizzyHowell #Transformation

raw_videos.title: Taylor Swift - Cardigan (ILLUJN Remix) Dance Choreography ft Nicole Laeno
raw_videos.description:
▶ Learn this dance with us online: http://DNCR.com 
▶ Stream 'Cardigan': https://stem.ffm.to/cardigan
▶ 'Cardigan' Music Video - ILLUJN ft Madilyn Bailey: https://youtu.be/NgebX84Ap4s

So I made this remix to Cardigan myself with vocals by my amazing friend Madelyn Bailey (@MadilynBailey), which means this song is up on SPOTIFY & APPLE MUSIC for you guys!!  Just search my artist name 'ILLUJN' and you'll find it (@ILLUJN on instagram).  So excited to be able to start making more music for us to dance to and really appreciate your support!!

Now about the dance, this is an advanced piece that I choreographed with Nicole to give you challenge and push you to the next level!  In this routine there's isolations, grooves, tutting, footwork and some advanced musicality that will help you get to the next level.  We did a full length tutorial up on http://dncr.com so go learn it with us and post up your covers!

▶ Follow Nicole: http://instagram.com/NicoleLaeno

raw_videos.title: Cardi B - I LIKE IT Dance | Matt Steffanina Choreography | DanceCon Ep. 6
X (Equis) - Nicky Jam & J Balvin Dance | Matt Steffanina | DANCECON 6: Atlanta
raw_videos.description:
X (Equis) - Nicky Jam & J Balvin Dance | Choreography by Matt Steffanina 
▶ DANCE VIDEO: https://youtu.be/X1mkMfGsEqo
▶ SUBSCRIBE: http://bit.ly/2uXO9aZ


▶  INSTAGRAM: http://instagram.com/MattSteffanina
▶ TWITTER: http://twitter.com/MattSteffanina

DanceCon is a reality show where the challenge is to put together workshops, auditions & a video shoot in a random city, in only 3 days!!  Dancers that get chosen at the audition immediately go into rehearsals for the video with less than 24 hours to learn the routine and film an epic dance concept video with Matt and his LA crew.

raw_videos.title: 7 DAY ABS CHALLENGE
raw_videos.description:
How I got ABS in ONE WEEK without pills or supplements!  
After my neck injury I wasn't able to dance or workout for a month.  I got out of shape and was feeling frustrated and depressed, but once my doctors finally cleared me to dance again I had 4 days until Coachella and heading back on tour.

I decided that I would take a picture that day and take another one 7 days later after coachella to keep me motivated to workout and eat healthy over the BIGGEST PARTY WEEKEND OF THE YEAR to see if I could really stick to my plan and complete a full body tranformation.

Sometimes setting a goal that puts pressure on you is what it takes to get that extra motivation you need.  Even though I was a personal trainer for 5 years I knew it was going to be difficult and there would be times I would want to give up.

So I used you guys as motivation when it got tough, I didn't want to let you down!!  So thank you for helping me.  now it's your turn!! 

Give this video a thumbs up if you liked it and hit me on instagram with your own before and after shots. summer is coming, no excuses!  #teamsteff

Get this to 20,000 LIKES + Notifications On if you want me to come back!!
▶ INSTAGRAM: http://instagram.com/MattSteffanina

I TRIED pole dancing during the europe tour and it's harder than it looks.

If you made it to the end of the video you heard what I want for this coming year.  For us to support each other, grow together and push our limits.  There's so much negativity in the world, in the industry, but not in my team.  If you are here, you're making a commitment to LIFT people up around you.  To spread LOVE to the rest of our community.  If you do that, watch what happens to your own success.  

-Matt

raw_videos.title: MOTOR SPORT - Cardi B x Migos x Nicki Minaj Dance | Matt Steffanina cover
raw_videos.description:
Motor Sport.  They BLOCKED my video so... I HAD TO RAP
▶TUTORIAL: https://youtu.be/GCvpcM7CCPc
▶ INSTAGRAM: http://instagram.com/MattSteffanina 
I would rather dance to Migos, but if I have to dance to Matt'gos it's still gonna be lit.  Comment some 🔥🔥 and keep reading below if you with me cause it's dumb af.
I have so many videos that I've never been able to share with you guys because the labels blocked them.  They already keep all the money, I just want to be able to post a dance clip to 40 seconds of a song.  

Labels, I'm not stealing your work, I'm promoting your artists.  Some labels DO understand this and we are winning together, while others don't want to accept it.  I invite you to open your minds to the possibility of us working together, as partners... you guys already hire me to choreograph for your artists, why not get some free promo out of it at the same time?

Dance is powerful.  It's an art that makes people connect emotionally to music, your music, streaming your songs, making you money... ya feel me? win/win/win/win/win

and until ya feel me.... I'm a rapper.  skrrrt skrrrt

ya'll I got a bunch new vids comin so subscribe + turn on notifications to join the fam!!

***********************
Award Winning choreographer Matt Steffanina has been dancing in movies, TV shows and alongside artists like Jason Derulo, Taylor Swift, and Chris Brown for the past 10 years.  Last year he won CBS's Emmy award winning show "The Amazing Race" elevating him from a well-known choreographer to an international TV personality.  He is also the executive producer, and co-creator of the shows "Dance Off Juniors", "BoySquad" & "DanceCon".

Matt is the most followed dancer in the world with over 11 million subscribers on his youtube channels totaling over 1.5 BILLION views.  largely in part to his FREE instructional youtube channel DanceTutorialsLive where he and his instructors teach millions of dancers around the world each month.  Using his online platforms he strives to create more opportunities for the community of hip hop dancers both in Los Angeles and around the world online.

***********************

FAQ::
Q: Who are your favorite artists to dance to?
A: Jason Derulo, Justin Bieber, Chris Brown, Rihanna, Beyonce, Taylor Swift

Q: Where can we get more info on workshops?
A: Sign up for the mailing list on my website http://mattsteffanina.com & follow me on instagram (http://instagram.com/mattsteffanina)

Q: What do you recommend for someone that is new to dance?
A: Start with the easier tutorials on DanceTutorialsLive (http://bit.ly/2jks81c) and work your way up to the harder routines.  Remember that it takes time to learn how to dance and pick up choreography so don't be hard on yourself.  Track your progress by filming yourself and when you feel comfortable to upload your first cover tag us @DNCRvids & @MattSteffanina on Instagram so we can check it out.  

If you have a local studio in your area it's a great idea to get into some weekly classes too.  Experiment with different teachers and style to find what works best for you.  Above all remember that dancing should be fun, enjoy the process and support others in the community!

_____________________________


ABOUT MATT:
While living in Virginia Matt became interested in dance at age 17. With no dance studios in the area he began teaching himself hip hop and breakdancing by watching music videos. In 2007, Matt found youtube and began posting dance videos and tutorials to document his progress and share what he was learning with other dancers around the world. A couple years later he made his move to Hollywood to pursue the dream of becoming a professional dancer. 

Matt continued posting videos in LA and in 2012 started a youtube channel dedicated to creating free instructional videos from the worlds top choreographers for people like him that wanted to learn how to dance, but didn't have the opportunity to get into advanced classes. (http://youtube.com/dancetutorialslive)

Today, Matt’s credits include: Taylor Swift, Jason Derulo, So You Think You Can Dance, The Ellen Show, Step Up, Chris Brown, Krewella, Snoop Dogg, Wiz Khalifa and more. In 2016 he won The Amazing Race transforming him from a well known choreographer to an international superstar. Matt is the most viewed choreographer in the world with over 10 million subscribers on YouTube and over 1.5 billion views on his videos. Despite his success he has remained loyal to his students around the world and still posts free dance videos and tutorials to his channels regularly!

ABOUT MATT:
While living in Virginia Matt became interested in dance at age 17. With no dance studios in the area he began teaching himself hip hop and breakdancing by watching music videos. Matt discovered youtube in 2007 and began posting dance videos and tutorials to document his progress and share what he was learning with other dancers around the world. A couple years later he made his move to Hollywood to pursue the dream of becoming a professional dancer. 

Matt continued posting videos in LA and in 2012 started a youtube channel dedicated to creating free instructional videos from the worlds top choreographers for people like him that wanted to learn how to dance, but didn't have the opportunity to get into advanced classes. (http://youtube.com/dancetutorialslive)

Today, Matt’s credits include: Jason Derulo, Taylor Swift, So You Think You Can Dance, The Ellen Show, Step Up, Chris Brown, Krewella, Snoop Dogg, Wiz Khalifa and more. In 2016 he won The Amazing Race transforming him from a well known choreographer to an international superstar. Matt is the most viewed choreographer in the world with over 10 million subscribers on YouTube and over 1.5 billion views on his videos. Despite his success he has remained loyal to his students around the world and still posts free dance videos and tutorials to his channels regularly!

Award Winning choreographer Matt Steffanina has been dancing in movies, TV shows and alongside artists like Jason Derulo, Taylor Swift, and Chris Brown for the past 10 years.  Last year he won CBS's Emmy award winning show "The Amazing Race" elevating him from a well-known choreographer to an international TV personality.  He is also the executive producer, and co-creator of the shows "Dance Off Juniors", "BoySquad" & "DanceCon".

Matt is the most followed dancer in the world with over 11 million subscribers on his youtube channels totaling over 1.5 BILLION views.  largely in part to his FREE instructional youtube channel DanceTutorialsLive where he and his instructors teach millions of dancers around the world each year.  Using his online platforms he strives to create more opportunities for the community of hip hop dancers both in Los Angeles and around the world online.

FAQ::
Q: Who are your favorite artists to dance to?
A: Jason Derulo, Justin Bieber, Chris Brown, Rihanna, Beyonce, Taylor Swift

Q: Where can we get more info on workshops?
A: Sign up for the mailing list on my website http://mattsteffanina.com & follow me on instagram (http://instagram.com/mattsteffanina)

Q: What do you recommend for someone that is new to dance?
A: Start with the easier tutorials on DanceTutorialsLive (http://bit.ly/2jks81c) and work your way up to the harder routines.  Remember that it takes time to learn how to dance and pick up choreography so don't be hard on yourself.  Track your progress by filming yourself and when you feel comfortable to upload your first cover tag us @DNCRvids & @MattSteffanina on Instagram so we can check it out.  

If you have a local studio in your area it's a great idea to get into some weekly classes too.  Experiment with different teachers and style to find what works best for you.  Above all remember that dancing should be fun, enjoy the process and support others in the community!

raw_videos.description:
WILD THOUGHTS - DJ Khaled ft Rihanna hip hop dance video choreographed by Matt Steffanina & Samantha Caudle!!
▶ TUTORIAL: https://youtu.be/nEXXYdKwhWM
▶ SUBSCRIBE: https://www.youtube.com/user/MattSdance?sub_confirmation=1
▶ INSTAGRAM:  http://instagram.com/MattSteffanina
▶ FACEBOOK: http://facebook.com/mattsteff
▶ DNCR APP: http://bit.ly/DNCRAPP

Song: "Wild Thoughts" - DJ Khaled ft Rihanna & Bryson Tiller
Choreography by: Matt Steffanina & Samantha Caudle
Filmed by: Typo
Edited by: Matt Steffanina

--- DANCERS ---
Group 1: Samantha Caudle, Matt Steffanina
Group 2: Gabe DeGuzman
Group 3: Jentry Robertson, Katrina Rosita, Marissa Simmons
Group 4: Tati McQuay, Kenneth San Jose, Bailey Sok
Group 5: Haley Ahern, Jordan Lane, Zealand Yancy, Yasmine

_____________________________


ABOUT MATT:
Living in a small town in Virginia Matt became interested in dance at age 17.  With no dance studios in the area he began teaching himself hip hop and breakdancing by watching music videos. In 2007 Matt discovered youtube and began posting dance videos and tutorials to document his progress and share what he was learning with other dancers around the world.  A couple years later he made his move to Hollywood to pursue the dream of becoming a professional dancer. 

Matt continued posting videos in LA and in 2012 started a youtube channel dedicated to creating free instructional videos from the worlds top choreographers for people like him that had dreams of learning how to dance or even becoming professional. (http://youtube.com/dancetutorialslive)
 
Today, Matt’s credits include: Jason Derulo, Taylor Swift, So You Think You Can Dance, The Ellen Show, Step Up, Chris Brown, Krewella, Snoop Dogg, Wiz Khalifa and more. In 2016 he won The Amazing Race transforming him from a well known choreographer to an international superstar. Matt is the most viewed choreographer in the world with over 10 million subscribers on YouTube and over 1.5 billion views on his videos.  Despite his success he has remained loyal to his students around the world and still posts free dance videos and tutorials to his channels regularly!


----- TOP VIDEOS ----

"SHAPE OF YOU" - Ed Sheeran: https://youtu.be/lq5oUOKh368
"BAD AND BOUJEE" - Migos: https://youtu.be/vXUQcr1kTHQ
"JUJU ON THAT BEAT" - https://youtu.be/S7uNBC6VEuA
"DESPACITO" - Justin Bieber: https://youtu.be/1PKJS4qwdK8
"SWALLA" - Jason Derulo: https://youtu.be/vyleKZJXBN8
"WHIP NAE NAE" - Silento: https://youtu.be/N6M1i0wb5tU
"DANCECON 4" - https://youtu.be/pAxgqLz1w9g


FAQ::

Q: Who are your favorite artists to dance to?
A: Jason Derulo, Justin Bieber, Chris Brown, Rihanna, Beyonce, Taylor Swift

Q: Where can we get more info on workshops?
A: Sign up for the mailing list on my website http://mattsteffanina.com & follow me on instagram (http://instagram.com/mattsteffanina)

Q: What songs have been your favorites videos to make?
A: Sometimes I like the really chill shoots like the Juju dance video which was choreographed in filmed in under a couple hours.  Other times it's class videos like Ed Sheeran - Shape Of You which we spent nearly a full day choreographing.

Q: What else do you like to do besides dance?
A: I love snowboarding, DJing, fitness, acting, rapping, playing the guitar, beatboxing, writing, comedy... and probably a bunch more.  Am I good at all those? no ;)

DanceCon is a reality show where the challenge is to put together workshops, auditions & a video shoot in a random city, in only 3 days!!  Dancers that get chosen at the audition immediately go into rehearsals for the video.  With less than 24 hours from audition to shoot, we have to make a full-scale, professional music video.

raw_videos.title: DANCING IN DUBAI || MY FIRST VLOG EVER!!
raw_videos.description:
After years of you asking... I MADE MY FIRST VLOG in Dubai!!
▶ PHILIPPINES VLOG: https://youtu.be/DDIk2FspqrY
▶ INSTAGRAM: http://instagram.com/MattSteffanina
▶ 2ND CHANNEL FOR MORE VLOGS: https://www.youtube.com/user/MattSteffanina?sub_confirmation=1
▶ SNAPCHAT: @MattSteffanina
▶ TUTORIALS: https://youtube.com/dancetutorialslive


_____________________________


I'm also going to vlog in the Philippines next week and want to have all you guys in it!  I'll be posting updates of where I'll be on twitter & instagram: @MattSteffanina.  

I'm so lucky to be able to go around the world performing and teaching so I wanted to start sharing more of my life with you all.  Hopefully this pushes you to go after the things that you want.   I started dancing at 18.... there's no way I should be doing this for a career, but I wanted it so badly.  I worked hard every single day, thought outside the box and didn't let anyone convince me that it wasn't possible.  You have the power to do the same, no matter what art form or business you want to start.  You have to be willing to work when others are sleeping, partying, and vacationing. but if you chase your dreams, put in the work, and succeed... it is ALL worth it.

raw_videos.title: "I WOULD LIKE" - Zara Larsson Dance | @MattSteffanina ft Shaun T
raw_videos.description:
I wanted to try something different with this video and tell you about some of the challenges I went through while trying to become a professional dancer.  While now you might see me traveling, teaching sold out classes, or getting views on videos etc. it wasn't always that way.  It's not the work you put in when you're on stage its the work you put in WHEN NOBODY IS WATCHING that separates you.

People like Shaun helped me stay on track when I was struggling in this business.  When you have people that believe in you, stay close to them.  Anyone that talks bad about you is trying to distract you from reaching your potential.

I recorded the vlog portion in one take on a 5-minute break between classes, it's not written out or even thought out (i think that's obvious lol) but just wanted to share a little more about me since you may be facing some of the same things I did.  Let me know if it's something you want me to do more often... or never again;)

Check out the podcast I did with Shaun at: ShaunTfitness.com/podcast

raw_videos.title: "ME, MYSELF & I" - G-Eazy | DanceCon EP. 3 | @MattSteffanina Choreography
raw_videos.description:
DanceCon Episode 3: "ME, MYSELF & I" - G-Eazy | Choreographed by Matt Steffanina
▶ WATCH Part 1: https://youtu.be/zO11uVycQCg
▶ INSTAGRAM: http://instagram.com/MattSteffanina

It took me nearly 2 months to edit both videos for this episode because I had so many other projects and trips overlapping, but I've learned so much through the process.  Teaching you for a couple hours in class is one thing, but getting to spend the day (and usually night) working with you guys on a video that will be a part of our lives forever is amazing.  It's so cool to see our 'DanceCon' alumni in LA, booking jobs and working together on projects after we finish shooting.  You guys are now part of a family that's growing every episode and I couldn't be more proud of what we've done together on these first 3 videos :)

Special thanks to the 'Lighting Dads' who helped me move lights around all day because I had so many different locations I wanted to shoot within this warehouse.  Mr. Rubiano for picking up the lights, Antonio's mom for the speaker, Mr. Micelli for staying late and helping me learn how to Weld.  Dana for being tireless in helping me find a last minute location when our original building fell through, Rickie for killin the special fx on this, and ALL the dancers & parents that stayed up shooting all night to make this video happen.


::VIDEO CREDITS::
▶ Produced & Directed by: Matt Steffanina (@MattSteffanina)
▶ Filmed & Special FX by: Typo  (@MyTypoLife)
▶ Edited by: Matt Steffanina
▶ Choreography by: Matt Steffanina

raw_videos.title: "THIS IS WHAT YOU CAME FOR" - Rihanna X Calvin Harris Dance | @MattSteffanina ft Conor Maynard
raw_videos.description:
▶ INSTAGRAM:  http://instagram.com/MattSteffanina
▶ TUTORIAL: https://youtu.be/NRmf8_Hc36Y
There is a WIN/WIN option for record labels and dancers!!  Help me spread this message so we can start to make a change for the dance community.  Help them understand that dancers don't want to steal music or hurt the record labels in any way.  We actually want to SUPPORT the artists we like by choreographing to their music (short sections) and sharing it with millions of people.

Stay connected with me on social media, we can make a change together.... for our kids, our kids kids, their kids kids kids kids kids ;)

raw_videos.title: DANCECON Ep. 1 | "I'LL SHOW YOU" - Justin Bieber | @MattSteffanina Choreography #DanceCon
raw_videos.description:
I'LL SHOW YOU - Justin Bieber (PolyCrave Remix) | DanceCon Episode 1: Concept Video by Matt Steffanina 
▶  WATCH DanceCon PART 1: https://youtu.be/tXdMfBgIoOk
▶  TWITTER & INSTAGRAM: @MattSteffanina

DanceCon is a dance-reality show where the challenge is to put together a successful dance event in only 3 days which includes workshops, auditions & a video shoot!!  Dancers that get chosen at the audition immediately go into rehearsals for the video.  Can a group of strangers pull off a dope concept video in under 24 hours?  Will anyone even show up for the classes & audition?  Let's find out...

---------- FRANK & OAK -----------

- State Concepts by Frank & Oak is a line of premium utility gear. A collision of considered technology, progressive construction and modern street aesthetic allowing wearers to go from a pickup game of basketball to a start-up war room without a second thought.

- Frank & Oak's Hunt Club is their exclusive members program that anyone can sign up to. First time users will even get the first 90 days free of charge (afterwards it'll cost $20 for 12 months). Some of the great perks of the Hunt Club include free shipping both ways, 4% store credit for every purchase you make, along with Home Try-On (pick up to 7 items at the start of every month to try on and only pay for the ones that you decide to keep, send back the rest with free shipping). And if you need help picking out styles, try out Frank & Oak's Select program where a Style Advisor will pick the clothes for you after you fill out a short questionnaire.

raw_videos.title: LET IT GO | @MattSteffanina Choreography | #EastLosHigh (@ChoSneed)
raw_videos.description:
LET IT GO | Matt Steffanina Dance Video | Directed by Tim Milgram
Twitter & Instagram: @MattSteffanina | Twitter & Instagram: @TimMilgram
--- Create your own video to Let It Go for a chance to win $2500 and a 1 year subscription for Hulu! And don’t forget to watch the new season of East Los High on July 15 only on Hulu!

Here are the rules: 

1. Create your own dance video set to the song “Let It Go” by Chonique Sneed. The video must be at least 5 seconds, and no longer than 1 minute. 

2. Post the video to YouTube, Instagram, Vine or Twitter.

3. Add the hashtags #EastLosDanceBattle and #Entry in the title, description, and within the video itself!

For complete contest rules, visit: http://www.danceon.com/contest/eastlosdancebattle


--- FULL CREDITS ---

Produced by: DanceOn & Hulu
Concept & Choreography: Matt Steffanina

NICO & VINZ - Am I Wrong Dance Video | Choreography by Matt Steffanina | Filmed at Matt's class @ Edge in Los Angeles, CA

Learn how to dance w/ our TUTORIALS at: youtube.com/dancetutorialslive

This is my favorite song, hands down.  Been wanting to choreograph to it for awhile, but it's so different than what I usually do I wasn't sure how to go about it.  After sitting on it for a few weeks I decided to go for it & had so much fun teaching this combo.  Thank you to everyone for coming out to class and going for it with me.  Hopefully Nico & Vinz will see this, would love to work with them :)

raw_videos.title: XSCAPE - Michael Jackson Dance Video | Directed by @MattSteffanina (Matt Steffanina)
raw_videos.description:
Michael Jackson - XSCAPE Dance Video |  Choreography by Matt Steffanina, Ricardo Walker & Dana Alexa | Learn how to dance: youtube.com/DanceTutorialsLive

Instagram & Twitter » @MattSteffanina 

As dancers, we all grew up with the dream of being on stage with Michael Jackson.  And to this day, he continues to live on and inspire dancers around the world through his music.  While no one will ever be able to duplicate Michael's style, we wanted to make a tribute to the greatest performer that's ever graced a stage.  Thank you Michael for all your inspiration and the passion you put into your music, we will always remember you as the greatest of all time.

Big thank you to the dancers: Ricardo, Dana, Ellyott, Mio, Anna, Michael - our videographers Baxter & Jeremy - and Athletic Garage for letting us shoot at their amazing space!

Choreography by: Matt Steffanina, Ricardo Walker, Dana Alexa
Directed & Edited by: Matt Steffanina

raw_videos.title: WAKE ME UP - Avicii Dance | @MattSteffanina Choreography Video | Matt Steffanina 2013
raw_videos.description:
Avicii - WAKE ME UP | Dance Choreography by Matt Steffanina » Click HERE to check out the TUTORIAL: http://youtu.be/58__gEQdmxE 

Get TEXT alerts when we post new videos: http://motube.us/mattsdance

I grew up in a small town and was always inspired by acoustic, blues & bluegrass so when I heard those styles mixed with electronic & dance music like this I fell in love with this song.  Music like this is really refreshing so make sure you support the artist, Avicii, and get into him because he's incredible.  I want to thank Dana because originally I choreographed this for myself just because I liked the song.  I wasn't going to teach it or tape it because it was so different than what I usually do and she encouraged me to be ok with that and to share it.

Sometimes my students teach me as much as I teach them.  Seeing you guys excited about trying something different and pushing yourselves was really inspiring for me.  So thank you Dana Alexa, Kyle McCraw, Alex Johnson, Lily J Molina, Walter Moran, Amber Boone, Cameron, Denis Kochkin, Henry Newby & everyone else that came and went full out, for sharing your talent with me :)  

For Dance Tutorials check out: http://youtube.com/dancetutorialslive

raw_videos.title: Hip Hop Choreographer & Teacher - Matt Steffanina 2012 Dance Reel » Hip Hop
raw_videos.description:
Choreography & Teaching Reel - Matt Steffanina - Los Angeles, CA
http://twitter.com/mattsteffanina
Matt teaches open classes @ IDA HOLLYWOOD every Sunday 4:00 & Monday 6:00!

Matt Steffanina began dancing in Virginia where he was the head choreographer of the VA based dance crew, Xtasee. After moving to LA, Matt signed with Clear Talent Group and began working in the commercial industry dancing for artists such as Chris Brown, Lil Wayne, Jermaine Jackson, Snoop Dogg, DJ Tiesto, and Busta Rhymes. In the past year, Matt has performed on So You Think You Can Dance, The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, and under the direction of Shane Sparks on Eva's 2011 promo tour. Matt has been teaching around the country for over 8 years and currently teaches open hip hop classes weekly at IDA in Hollywood.

raw_videos.title: Matt Steffanina & Dana Alexa Teaching Reel 2011
raw_videos.description:
Matt Steffanina began dancing in Virginia where he was the head choreographer of the VA based dance crew, Xtasee.  He relocated to Los Angeles in 2010 after spending seven years working as a dancer and teacher on the east coast. After moving to LA, Matt signed with Clear Talent Group and began working in the commercial industry dancing for artists such as Chris Brown, Lil Wayne, Jermaine Jackson, Snoop Dogg, DJ Tiesto, and Busta Rhymes.  In the past year, Matt has performed on So You Think You Can Dance, The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, and under the direction of Shane Sparks on Eva's 2011 promo tour.  Matt teaches weekly at IDA in Hollywood as well as teaching workshops and master classes around the country.

Dana Alexa was born in Brooklyn NY and started her dance career at 2 years old. Dana became an instructor at the age of 12 and has been teaching all over the country ever since.  Dana works with her students to build confidence, style and instill a love of dance. She has taught all ages and levels for HS and college dance teams, studios, pro teams, semi-pro teams and more. Dana's went on to represent NYC as a Knicks City Dancer before dancing with recording artist Kat Deluna on her world promo tour. In addition, Dana became Kat's choreographer and choreographed all of her stage shows and two music videos.  Dana is currently working with her all female crew VENOM (as Seen on CBS's hit show Live to Dance) and her convention series Twisted City.

raw_videos.title: SCARY MONSTERS - Skrillex DUBSTEP Dance Choreography » Matt Steffanina Hip Hop
raw_videos.description:
Skrillex - Scary Monsters and Nice Sprites
Choreography by Matt Steffanina & Danny Axley

We had a rainy day off while we were in Korea and couldn't sit still.  Wanted to do something quirky and fun so I choreographed this with Danny in our hotel room and shot it that evening.  We wanted to vibe off the two extremes in the song and just goof off for a bit.   This is what we came up with... hope you dig it!
